title: Using the OR operator
text: The data row is kept if either conditional on the two sides of the OR statement are satisfied.

title: The $$ \neq $$ Operator
text: The $$ \neq $$ operator is comparing if two things are "not equal" to each other, in this case, the string literal values.

title: The $$=$$ Operator
text: The $$=$$ operator compares if two things are equal in value, such as if two strings are made of the same letters.

title: The > Operator
text: The > operator is used to numerically compare if the value is greater than some specified quantity.
